solution_line_template: Cory takes {richard_time} + {cory_more_than_richard} = <<{richard_time}+{cory_more_than_richard}={cory_time}>>{cory_time} minutes to clean her room.
Blake takes {cory_time} - {blake_quicker_than_cory} = <<{cory_time}-{blake_quicker_than_cory}={blake_time}>>{blake_time} minutes to clean his room.
The three of them can clean their room in {richard_time} + {cory_time} + {blake_time} = <<{richard_time}+{cory_time}+{blake_time}={total_time_per_cleaning}>>{total_time_per_cleaning} minutes in all.

In a week, they spend {total_time_per_cleaning} x {cleanings_per_week} = <<{total_time_per_cleaning}*{cleanings_per_week}={total_weekly_cleaning_time}>>{total_weekly_cleaning_time} minutes cleaning their rooms.
